configPath.description: Path to a custom stryker config file.

mutate.description: With mutate you configure the subset of files to use for mutation testing. Generally speaking, these should be your own source files.

files.description: With files you can choose which files should be included in your test runner sandbox.

reporters.description: With reporters you can set the reporters for stryker to use. These reporters can be used out of the box: clear-text, progress, dots, dashboard and event-recorder.

testRunner.description: With testRunner you specify the test runner that Stryker uses to run your tests.

testFramework.description: Configure which test framework you are using. This option is not mandatory, as Stryker is test framework agnostic (it doesn't care what framework you use).

transpilers.description: With transpilers you configure which transpiler plugins should transpile the code before it's executed.

plugins.description: With plugins you can add additional Node modules for Stryker to load (or require).

port.description: With port you specify the first port to pass on to the test runner to use. Any additional test runners will be spawned using ports n+1, n+2.

timeoutMS.description: When Stryker is mutating code, it cannot determine indefinitely whether or not a code mutation results in an infinite loop (see Halting problem). In order to battle infinite loops, a test run gets killed after a certain period of time. This period is configurable with two settings: timeoutMS and timeoutFactor. timeoutForTestRunMs = netTimeMs * timeoutFactor + timeoutMS + overheadMs

maxConcurrentTestRunners.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent test runners to spawn.

symlinkNodeModules.description: The symlinkNodeModules value indicates whether or not Stryker should create a symbolic link to your current node_modules directory in the sandbox directories.

coverageAnalysis.description: With coverageAnalysis you specify which coverage analysis strategy you want to use. Possible values: off, all and perTest.

mutator.description: With mutator you configure which mutator plugin you want to use, and optionally, which mutation types to exclude from the test run.

logLevel.description: Set the log level that Stryker uses to write to the console. Possible values: off, fatal, error, warn, info, debug and trace.

fileLogLevel.description: Set the log level that Stryker uses to write to the 'stryker.log' file. Possible values: off, fatal, error, warn, info, debug and trace.
